member.name: M:Gadgeteer.Modules.GHIElectronics.WiFi_RS21.Scan
member.summary: This function scans for all access points in range with any channel.
member.returns: An array of the found access point.

member.name: M:Gadgeteer.Modules.GHIElectronics.WiFi_RS21.Search(System.String)

member.name: M:Gadgeteer.Modules.GHIElectronics.WiFi_RS21.Join(Gadgeteer.Modules.GHIElectronics.WiFi_RS21.WiFiNetworkInfo)
member.param: Wireless network information (usually it is generated by or method)

member.name: M:Gadgeteer.Modules.GHIElectronics.WiFi_RS21.Join(Gadgeteer.Modules.GHIElectronics.WiFi_RS21.WiFiNetworkInfo,System.String)
member.param: Wireless network information (usually it is generated by or method)

equals "" for open networks.
With WPA or WPA2, it is a plain string Pass phrase. For example:"password"
With WEP, Key1 should be use in HEX format in a string. For example: if the Key 1 is 0xE8430A5EDB then use this string "E8430A5EDB".

member.name: P:Gadgeteer.Modules.GHIElectronics.WiFi_RS21.IsNetworkConnected
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this wi-fi module has established a media link.

remarks.para: This property enables you to determine if the WiFi module has established a link with a network device, such as a wireless router. When this property is true, it does not necessarily mean that the network connection is functional. You must also check the property. returns true if the network connection is both connected and configured for Internet Proctocol (IP) communication tasks.
remarks.note: When is true, it does not necessarily mean that the network connection is functional. The IP configuration for the network connection may be invalid for the network that it is connected to.

member.name: F:Gadgeteer.Modules.GHIElectronics.WiFi_RS21.WiFiNetworkInfo.RSSI
member.summary: Received signal strength indication in -dB unit

member.name: F:Gadgeteer.Modules.GHIElectronics.WiFi_RS21.WiFiNetworkInfo.SSID
